abstract: China National Petroleum Corp., parent of the state-run oil and gas giant PetroChina, announced Wednesday that it had received a low-interest $30 billion loan to finance overseas acquisitions.
snippet: China National Petroleum Corp., parent of the state-run oil and gas giant PetroChina, announced Wednesday that it had received a low-interest $30 billion loan to finance overseas acquisitions.
lead_paragraph: The China National Petroleum Corporation, parent of the state-run oil and gas giant PetroChina, announced Wednesday that it had received a low-interest $30 billion loan to finance overseas acquisitions — the latest sign that Beijing was deploying its vast cash reserves to ensure that its economy has the resources to keep growing.

headline.main: PetroChina Parent Gets $30 Billion for Acquisitions
